goal: Rename 8 misleading tests to match actual functionality

steps.desc: Rename CONN-01: WeSign Main Site Accessibility
steps.success: Test name accurately reflects HTTP status and title checking

details.current_function: Only checks HTTP status <400 and non-empty title
details.misleading_aspect: Claims 'accessibility' but does no WCAG testing
details.recommended_name: CONN-01: WeSign Main Site HTTP Response
alternative_names: CONN-01: WeSign Main Site Basic Connectivity
CONN-01: WeSign Main Site Status Check

implementation.step_2: Update console logs to reflect actual functionality
implementation.step_3: Add comment explaining what real accessibility testing would involve
implementation.step_4: Consider adding optional real accessibility testing

steps.desc: Rename CONN-02: WeSign Login Page Response
steps.success: Test name reflects input field detection, not login functionality

details.current_function: Counts any input fields on page, no login testing
details.recommended_name: CONN-02: WeSign Login Page Input Field Detection
alternative_names: CONN-02: WeSign Login Page Form Elements
CONN-02: WeSign Login Page Structure Check
CONN-02: WeSign Login Page Element Presence

implementation.step_1: Update test name to reflect input field counting
implementation.step_2: Clarify in comments that this doesn't test login functionality
implementation.step_3: Update success message to be accurate
implementation.step_4: Consider renaming to focus on page structure validation

steps.success: Test name reflects basic presence check, not comprehensive detection

details.current_function: Counts forms across multiple pages, ignores page load failures
details.recommended_name: UI-01: Basic Form Element Presence Check

implementation.step_1: Rename to emphasize 'basic' and 'presence' rather than 'detection'
implementation.step_3: Note that this doesn't test form functionality
implementation.step_4: Consider adding form validation testing separately

steps.success: Test name reflects element counting, not interaction testing

details.current_function: Only counts elements, doesn't test interaction

implementation.step_1: Change name to emphasize counting vs testing interaction
implementation.step_2: Add comment noting that interaction functionality is not tested
implementation.step_4: Consider adding actual interaction testing as separate test

steps.success: Test name reflects framework API check, not healing validation

details.current_function: Tests framework API enabled status and finds body element

implementation.step_1: Rename to reflect API/integration testing focus
implementation.step_2: Clarify that this tests framework status, not healing scenarios
implementation.step_3: Update comments to explain what comprehensive healing tests would include
implementation.step_4: Consider adding real healing scenario tests

steps.success: Test name reflects standard TestInfo validation, not enhanced features

details.misleading_aspect: Claims 'enhanced' functionality but tests standard features

implementation.step_1: Remove 'Enhanced' from name and replace with 'Standard'
implementation.step_2: Update comments to clarify standard vs enhanced features
implementation.step_3: Note what enhanced reporting would actually include
implementation.step_4: Consider implementing actual enhanced reporting features

steps.desc: Rename BUSINESS-02: Document Processing Flow Check
steps.success: Test name reflects page availability, not workflow validation

details.current_function: Only checks if document-related pages exist, no workflow testing

implementation.step_1: Rename to emphasize page availability vs workflow testing
implementation.step_2: Update description to clarify this is connectivity, not business logic
implementation.step_3: Add comment about what real workflow testing would involve
implementation.step_4: Consider implementing actual document workflow tests

steps.success: Test name reflects basic element counting, not UX validation

details.current_function: Counts page elements and checks for title/description
details.misleading_aspect: Claims UX validation but doesn't test user experience

implementation.step_1: Replace 'User Experience Validation' with accurate element counting description
implementation.step_2: Update comments to clarify this doesn't test actual UX
implementation.step_3: Note what real UX validation would include (usability, interaction flows)
implementation.step_4: Consider adding real UX testing (task completion, user journeys)

constraints: Maintain test IDs and structure to preserve test suite organization
Update all related console logs and comments for consistency
Preserve existing test functionality while clarifying purpose
Ensure new names are descriptive but concise
rollback_plan: Keep original test names in comments for reference
success_criteria: All test names accurately describe their actual functionality
No misleading claims about comprehensive testing features
Clear distinction between basic checks and comprehensive validation
Comments explain what comprehensive testing would actually involve
